data.title: Shakespeare Birthplace Trust
data.text:
Letters, mainly personal, to Thomas Lucas of Stratford-upon-Avon, druggist, with ticket for Stratford Tradesman's Library, 1827.

Papers in case Collis' executors v. Mrs. Veronica Russwurm of Stratford-upon-Avon for schooling fees for her son.

Draft Bonds, contract etc. by C.M. Tombs to Edgar Flower for the building of new stables at Middle Hill, Worcs.

Will, testamentary and probate papers of Thomas Miles of 'Mount Pleasant', Old Stratford.

Charging £16 per annum payable to the Borough of Stratford-upon-Avon for providing twenty-four alms-people with blue coats and gowns every...

Draft will of William Cox of Millway Toll Gate in the parish of Old Stratford.

Draft will[s] of Alice Barnes Holtom and Henrietta Holtom. See also DR325/1475

Papers relating to letting of rooms in No. 11 Guild Street by Charles Collingwood.

Correspondence and papers relating to financial transaction between E.F. Flower and Mr. Dowdeswell.

Appointment of new trustee of the said will

Papers relating to the financial difficulties of Capt. A. Durnford.

Draft deeds, plan etc. relating to Nos. 58-59 Shakespeare Street, Stratford-upon-Avon, with abstract of title from 1890.

Draft will of Miss H.E. Field of No. 26 New Broad Street, Stratford-upon-Avon. This record is closed.

Account book for the journey to Mediterranean coasts of France and Italy (via Paris).

Will, testamentary papers etc. of Mrs. Eliza Price, Stratford-upon-Avon (widow of William of Stratford-upon-Avon).

Draft deeds, etc. relating to premises in Henley Street and No. 26 Bridge Street, Stratford-upon-Avon.

Receipt from Exchequer to Sir Thomas Leigh, knight and baronet for 7s fee farm rent due for Hamstall Ridware, Staffs.

Schedule of documents 1560-1738 delivered to the Hon Robert Harley for the use of Mrs Peyto ` by him delivered to William Olorenshard'

Draft deed relating to two pieces of land in Old Stratford.

Draft deeds, sale particulars, plans etc. relating to Bishopton estate, with abstract of title from 1780.

Papers relating to formation of partnership between John Gamble and William Brown, both of Stratford-upon-Avon, dentists.

Bundle of receipts and vouchers labelled: `Bills of Hon. Rupert Leigh on setting out a second time for India

Correspondence and agreement of G.L. Lea of Nuneaton to become a Flower's agent.

c. 38 bills and a baker's account book mainly for Adlestrop estate.

Papers etc. relating to accounts due to and from the estate of W. Sharpe, tobacconist, No. 34 High Street, Stratford-upon-Avon.

Prompt book used for Royal Shakespeare Company production. The Bright and Bold Design by Peter Whelan. Director: Bill Alexander.

Papers relating to claim v. Birmingham and Aston Tramway Co. for damages as result of tram overturning.

Separate accounts for the school, one of the recipients of part of the Game Fund. Dated 1881-2, 1885-6, 1900-03.

Papers relating to transfer of shares in C. Lucy Nephew Ltd.

Contract with Lowry, of the 'Red Horse Hotel' for the building of a billiard room.

Abstract of title to part of an orchard in Bull Lane, Stratford-upon-Avon.

Papers relating to claim of Mrs. M. A. Sharman, boot and shoe retailer and repairer, against Joseph Hopkins.

Frederick Robson (1821-1864); signature, with newspaper cuttting concerning his appearance at the Royal Olympic Theatre

`A note of the fields, closes and groves within the manor'

Papers relating to claim of John Parker, fishmonger, v. C. Holtom and F. Winter for debt.

Correspondence with the Stratford-upon-Avon Railway Co. as to purchase of land by Gas Co.

H[enry] Ferrers, Walton to [Andrew] Archer: Thanks for invitation; will give good notice of arrival.

Bill of costs from Slatter, Son Gibbs in respect of various matters.

Abstract of title, from 1813, for Lot 15 (four cottages in Ullenhall).

Papers relating to right of way at Bishopton.

Copy sale particulars and agreement relating to purchase by R. H. Hobbes, solicitor, of £600 at interest on death of 'person' of 66.

Draft will of Thomas Hutchings, the younger, iron and coal merchant of Stratford-upon-Avon.

Accounts and papers relating to building work done by William James for E. Wynn at 'The Limes', Bishopton. Missing 4 February 1982.

Draft will of Mrs. A. Vincent, Alveston.

Lease of No. 33 Bridge Street ('The Old Swan'), Stratford-upon-Avon, by Thomas Hutchings, iron merchant, to R. M. Bird.

Draft deeds, sale particulars and conditions relating to No. 8 Evesham Place, Stratford-upon-Avon.

Deed relating to Nos. 18 Bridge Street, with garden rights in Nos. 8-9 High Street, Stratford-upon-Avon, leased to John Magenis.

Two letters concerning Adlestrop school and other Gloucestershire business.

Legal and financial papers of Charles Lucy as executor of William Tasker.

Draft deeds, legal papers, etc. relating to No. 10 Mansell Street, Stratford-upon-Avon.

Draft deed of covenant to produce title deeds in respect of premises and warehouses at Bridgefoot, Stratford-upon-Avon, with schedule,...

Testamentary papers of Miss A. Ovard of No. 2 New Street, Stratford-upon-Avon.

Will and testamentary papers of W. Price of Stratford-upon-Avon, builder.

Draft will of Miss A. North of Stratford-upon-Avon.

Correspondence relating to 'Avon Cliff', arising from the bankruptcy of William Walker.

Draft mortgage of Nos. 3 4 Bull Street, Stratford-upon-Avon by Jane Stephens.

Accounts and receipts from A. Rudge to Mrs. Dyer.

Will and probate of Mrs. Mary Mills of Stratford-upon-Avon, with papers and pedigree relating to the estate of Edward Stanley (1787).

Draft Marriage Settlement and related papers of Thomas Hutchings, junior and Miss Mary Frances Lucy.

Legal papers and correspondence relating to dispute with Frederick Moore relating to rent due on land at Loxley.

Sale particulars relating to furniture and furnishings in No. 29 Wood Street, Stratford-upon-Avon.

Business papers and correspondence of William King, ironmonger, of Stratford-upon-Avon.

Printed bye-laws for the regulation of Hackney Carriages in the town

Contract and specifications for building of a farmhouse and outbuildings for R A. Newland by William Martin.

Draft deeds, sale particulars, inventory, etc. relating to 'Avonside' and 'Avonfield', Stratford-upon-Avon.

Draft will of John Watts of Stratford-upon-Avon.

Covenant to Miss Anne Gibbs to produce title deeds to 'The Barracks' Shottery.

Draft wills of Mrs. E. A. North, formerly of Stratford-upon-Avon, now of Rhyl.

Ground plan of farm house and buildings at Studley called New Farm belonging to Robert Knight, esq., in fee by Edward Cooper.

Draft deed relating to house and malthouse in Shottery.

Receipt to John Biddle for 4s relief due on his house and ground called Bell Land on the death of his father Thomas Biddle.

Receipt from Richard Heathe to Richard Fullwood of Tanworth for 40s to the use of William Yardley

Annual reports, statements of account, notices of A.G.Ms., etc.

Testamentary papers of W. Martin; draft deeds, sale particulars etc. relating to Payton Street; Guild Street, Tyler Street,...

Various accounts, share certificates and financial papers.

Draft will, probate and testamentary papers of C. Mills, Alveston.

Miscellaneous financial papers of the Stratford Moreton Railway.

Two rent rolls for Tanworth and Solihull. [ref. to Sir John Gage [bt.d.1699]

Draft agreement to purchase messuage in Rother Street from Samuel Buffery.

Draft deeds, papers and correspondence relating to transfer of an interest under the will of Samuel Righton.

Declaration by George Finch, clerk to Messrs. Clarke, Fynmore and Fladgate, solicitors, in authentication of DR 36/177 made at the enrolment...

Accounts and bills of John White with Thomas White.

Further charge from George Henry Canning to Caroline Russell

Further charge from John Cory to Thomas Woods Weston

C. T. Warde in account with R. W. Freeman.

Rental of John Sceyft Endorsed in later hand `Yardley'

Draft will of Mrs. E. S. Stuart, Stratford-upon-Avon.
